DataElement.preferredName: Irradiated Granulocyte Infusion Procedure Administered Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not  irradiated granulocyte infusions were administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treated with radiation._A leucocyte with conspicuous cytoplasmic granules. In humans the granulocytes are also classified as polymorphonuclear leucocytes and are subdivided according to the staining properties of the granules into eosinophils, basophils and neutrophils._A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treated with radiation.:A leucocyte with conspicuous cytoplasmic granules. In humans the granulocytes are also classified as polymorphonuclear leucocytes and are subdivided according to the staining properties of the granules into eosinophils, basophils and neutrophils. (from On-line Medical Dictionary):A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.

Concepts.definition: A type of leukocyte with a multilobed nucleus and cytoplasmic granules. The unique morphology of the nucleus has led to their also being known as polymorphonuclear leukocytes (PMLs or PMNs). Granulocytes are subdivided according to the staining properties of their granules into eosinophils (red with acidic dye), basophils (blue with basic dye), and neutrophils (not amenable to staining with either acidic or basic dyes).
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
